com.dev.yvgenijsharovskij.n5kanjiandkanjistoryquiz.kanjilist

Class KanjiListManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dev.yvgenijsharovskij.n5kanjiandkanjistoryquiz.kanjilist.KanjiListManager

  • public class KanjiListManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Singleton manager class for the kanjilist package. This class will exists as long as the application stays in memory.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Yvgenij Sharovskij

    • Field Summary

      Retrieves the kanji, kana and English lists from the db columns (in the same order as the db), uses these lists to set each Kanji object and adds each kanji to mKanjiList.

      Updates the given Kanji in the SQL database using execSQL(), specifically the isIncluded column in the QNA table (other columns remain the same).

      Updates the given Kanji story: the current Kanji object and, optionally, in the SQL database using execSQL().

      Updates the radical list for the given Kanji: the current Kanji object and, optionally, in the SQL database using execSQL().

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static KanjiListManager getInstance(android.content.Context context)
        If the instance already exists, then getInstance(Context) simply returns the instance. If the instance does not exist yet, then getInstance(Context) will call the constructor to create it.
        Uses lazy initialization, whereby the instance is created when the static method is first invoked. Declared with Draconian synchronization.
        Parameters:
        context - Context
        Returns:
        instance of KanjiListManager

      • setupDb

        public void setupDb(android.content.Context context)
        Retrieves the kanji, kana and English lists from the db columns (in the same order as the db), uses these lists to set each Kanji object and adds each kanji to mKanjiList.
        Parameters:
        context - Context

      • updateKanjiStory

        public void updateKanjiStory(Kanji kanji,
                             @NonNull
                             java.lang.String updateValueString,
                             boolean isUpdatingDatabase)
        Updates the given Kanji story: the current Kanji object and, optionally, in the SQL database using execSQL().
        Parameters:
        kanji - the Kanji to update
        updateValueString - the string value to update
        isUpdatingDatabase - true, if updating the db

      • updateRadicalKeyList

        public void updateRadicalKeyList(Kanji kanji,
                                 java.lang.String updateValueString,
                                 boolean isUpdatingDatabase)
        Updates the radical list for the given Kanji: the current Kanji object and, optionally, in the SQL database using execSQL().
        Parameters:
        kanji - the Kanji to update
        updateValueString - the string value to update
        isUpdatingDatabase - true, if updating the db

      • updateKanji

        public void updateKanji(Kanji kanji)
        Updates the given Kanji in the SQL database using execSQL(), specifically the isIncluded column in the QNA table (other columns remain the same).
        Parameters:
        kanji - the Kanji to update

      • getKanjiList

        public java.util.LinkedList<Kanji> getKanjiList()
        Getter method for mKanjiList.
        Returns:
        mKanjiList of type LinkedList

      • getKanji

        @CheckResult(suggest="#enforcePermission(int)")
public Kanji getKanji(java.util.UUID id)
        Overloaded method which returns the Kanji object based on the id.
        Parameters:
        id - the Kanji id
        Returns:
        The Kanji object with an existing id.

      • getKanji

        @CheckResult(suggest="#enforcePermission(String)")
public Kanji getKanji(java.lang.String title)
        Overloaded method which returns the Kanji object based on the kanji title.
        Parameters:
        title - the kanji title
        Returns:
        Kanji: The Kanji object with an existing kanji title.

      • getKanji

        public Kanji getKanji(@NonNull
                      java.lang.String question,
                      java.lang.String questionType)
        Returns the Kanji object based on the question type.
        Parameters:
        question - the selected question
        questionType - the selected question type
        Returns:
        Kanji: The Kanji object based on the existing question type.

      • setCurrentIsIncludedList

        public void setCurrentIsIncludedList(java.util.LinkedList<Kanji> kanjiList)
        Sets the list of current values of Kanji.isIncluded() in the same order as the kanjilist.
        Note: relies on updating the list.
        Parameters:
        kanjiList - the LinkedList list of Kanji

      • getCurrentIsIncludedList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Boolean> getCurrentIsIncludedList()
        Getter method for mCurrentIsIncludedList.
        Returns:
        mCurrentIsIncludedList list of included kanji

      • getIsIncludedKanjiCount

        public int getIsIncludedKanjiCount()
        Getter method to return the count of all included kanji in the mKanjiList. Performs a fresh calculation; not based on mCurrentIsIncludedList.
        Returns:
        counter int value for each kanji.isIncluded()

      • getTotalKanjiListCount

        public int getTotalKanjiListCount()
        Getter method to return the mKanjiList.size().
        Returns:
        mKanjiList.size(), with constraint @IntRange(from=0, to=103)

      • getIsExcludedKanjiCount

        public int getIsExcludedKanjiCount()
        Getter method to return the number of excluded kanji.
        Note: the Link annotation here is set as @IntRange(from=0,to=102), which corresponds to the maximum number of kanji in the db minus 1, as at least 1 kanji has to be selected.
        Returns:
        ( getTotalKanjiListCount() - getIsIncludedKanjiCount() )

      • setKanjiListToSelectAll

        public void setKanjiListToSelectAll()
        Sets every kanji in the KajiList to kanji.setIncluded(true) and updates each of these kanji in the db.
        Used for the R.menu.toolbar_menu_kanji_list "Select all" menu item.

      • getKanjiStoryCount

        public int getKanjiStoryCount()
        Getter method to return the count of all kanji stories in the mKanjiList.
        Returns:
        counter int value for each kanji.isIncluded()

      • getIsIncludedKanjiStoryCount

        public int getIsIncludedKanjiStoryCount()
        Getter method to return the count of all included kanji with a kanji story in the mKanjiList.
        Returns:
        counter int value for each kanji.isIncluded()

      • doesEveryIncludedKanjiHaveAKanjiStory

        public boolean doesEveryIncludedKanjiHaveAKanjiStory()
        Checks if every included kanji in the mKanjiList got a kanji story.
        Returns:
        true, if every included kanji in the mKanjiList got a kanji story

      • getSplitStringAsList

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> getSplitStringAsList(java.lang.String inputString)
        Splits and trims a String with ";" as the separator.
        Parameters:
        inputString - the input string to process
        Returns:
        a List of the split and trimmed String

      • getListAsSplitString

        public java.lang.String getListAsSplitString(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> inputList)
        Splits and trims a String with ";" as the separator.

      • hasDuplicate

        public boolean hasDuplicate(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> list)
        Checks if a LinkedList contains a duplicate value by copying the list into a Set (which won't have duplicates) and then comparing their sizes.
        Parameters:
        list - the list to check for duplicates
        Returns:
        true, if the list contains at least one duplicate

      • setEditTextMaxLine

        public void setEditTextMaxLine(android.widget.EditText editText)
        Manually sets the max nr of lines for an EditText by deleting any text that is getLineCount() > 2.
        Parameters:
        editText - EditText

      • getPhotoFile

        @Nullable
public java.io.File getPhotoFile(Kanji kanji,
                                            android.content.Context context)
        Gets the photo hint file from external storage.
        Uses the Kanji.getPhotoHintFileName(int) method.
        Parameters:
        kanji - The Kanji for which to retrieve the photo.
        context - Context
        Returns:
        File: the Kanji photo hint file

      • doesPhotoFileExist

        public boolean doesPhotoFileExist(Kanji kanji,
                                  android.content.Context context)
        Checks if a (photo) file exists.
        Parameters:
        kanji - the Kanji for which to retrieve the photo
        context - Context
        Returns:
        boolean: true, if the (photo) file exists

      • deletePhotoFile

        public void deletePhotoFile(Kanji kanji,
                            android.content.Context context)
        Deletes an existing (photo) file.
        Parameters:
        kanji - the Kanji for which to retrieve the photo
        context - Context
